title: Hundreds gathered on 70th anniversary of Hiroshima bombing in Memorial Park
text:
Hundreds gathered on 70th anniversary of Hiroshima bombing in Memorial Park Published on : Thursday, August 6, 2015
Japanese citizens observed the 70th anniversary of the atomic bomb dropping by a US aircraft in Hiroshima.
The ceremony was held in the Memorial Park where thousands gathered to remember that day. Paper lanterns were released on the Motoyasu River of the city.
The two bombings at Hiroshima and Nagasaki are credited for bringing the World War Two to an end though it took away lives of 140,000 people. The city gathered to mourn on the permanent damages that were caused due to the bombing. There were many who suffered radiation poisoning that followed for months and severe injuries that continued for generation s together.
Those that gathered observed one minute silence to mark the anniversary. A bell tolled at 08:15 local time when the bomb dropped to flatten the city.
Prime Minister of Japan Shinzo Abe, called for worldwide disarmament. Bombs not only killed people but also caused suffering to those who survived. He voiced that the world should move towards peace. Mr. Abe released doves in declaration of peace.
